buildup.text: Pop psychology sorted people into left-brain (analytical) and right-brain (creative) types.

discovery.text: A 2013 fMRI study of 1,000 brains found no evidence of hemisphere dominance in personality.

twist.text: Both hemispheres collaborate on virtually every task, including math and music.

climax.text: The myth persists because it feels flatteringâ€”everyone wants to be a 'creative type.'

punchline.text: Your brain doesn't pick a side. Why should you?
